attributes.action: launch an initiative promoting the social, psychological and health benefits of smaller breasts and restrict NHS funding of cosmetic enhancement procedures.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The overt sexualisation of our youth is currently compounded by validation and implicit and explicit support, within popular culture and the health services, of larger breasts.

Large breasts are linked to obesity, diabetes, cancer and, of course, the NHS cosmetic surgery increases. 

By launching a strategy of communication, engagement and knowledge-sharing concerning both the 
- dangers and disadvantages of large breasts, as well as the; 
- benefits of more natural, proportional breasts,
women and girls would be at less medical risk and more socially secure, reducing resources within the health services dedicated to conditions stemming directly and indirectly to this dangerous phenomenon.

There is a critical mass within popular media to ensure success (e.g. venerations of "sporty" women in "Strictly Come Dancing" balanced by Jordan's well-publicised breast reductions for medical and personal reasons).

It is recommended that Victoria Beckham might lead such a campaign.
